chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: &productshort; can plan and track single and multi-tank dives using Air, Nitrox or TriMix. &productshort; allows tracking of dive locations including GPS coordinates (which can also conveniently be entered using a map interface), logging of equipment used and names of other divers, and lets users rate dives and provide additional notes.

You can tag dives and filter a dive list based on criteria including tags, locations and people with whom you were diving. You can group the dive list into trips, and edit multiple dives at the same time, making it easy to support a large number of dives.
One of the major strengths of Subsurface is its wide range of . Subsurface can also use existing dive logs from several .

Another strength is its ability to visualize the depth profile (and, if available, the tank pressure curve) in innovative ways that give the user additional information on relative velocity, and momentary air consumption, during a dive. Users who dive with multiple dive computers can combine the data from each of their dive computers into one dive – allowing visualization of the data collected from multiple sources.

&productshort; also calculates a wide variety of statistics of the user’s diving and tracks information like the SAC rate, partial pressures of O2, N2 and He, calculated deco information, and many more.
Multiple divers can share one instance of Subsurface using different preferences and settings.
The program is localized in about 20 languages and well supported by an active developer community.

sect1.title: Product Variants
sect1.para: &product; software is available as desktop, mobile and web application variants. Each of these has been named as follows:

listitem.para: The full program. An executable program installed on a desktop computer.
A mobile application installed on a smart phone.
A web application installed on the cloud and accessible by web browser.

sect1.para: Each variant of the software is not only designed to run on a different target hardware and environments, but also consistant of slight differences in functionality.

sect2.title: &productdesktop;
sect2.para: &productdesktop; is the name given to the full program that can be downloaded and installed on a computer desktop operating system such as Micoroft Windows, MacOS or Linux. &productdesktop; is fully featured and serves as the main program for recording and managing divelogs when using a desktop or laptop computer. While many features of &productdesktop; are also available in &productmobile;, some features are not. The Dive Planning module is only available in &productdesktop;.

sect2.title: &productmobile;
sect2.para: &productmobile; is the name given to the modile version of &productshort;. It can be downloaded and installed on a smart phone device and is partially featured. It serves as a more limited mobile version of &product; aimed at Android and iOS smartphone and tablet devices, allowing viewing, entering, sharing, and storage of dive information at dive sites where a larger computer is not useful.

While the desktop version of &product; shows much more detailed information for each dive, &productmobile; allows dive logs to be more accessible on a dive trip, where it is useful for providing proof of dive experience to dive shops or to review dives. &productmobile; also allows the gathering of GPS locations where dives are performed using the GPS modem that is an integral part of most mobile devices.

Users of &productmobile; typically use the mobile app as a companion to the desktop version, sharing dive information between the mobile and the desktop versions via the &productcloud; service. However, &productmobile; can also be used independently of the desktop version and does not require the use of cloud storage.

These items are discussed in greater detail in the following text. &productmobile; does not support download of dive data from all the dive computers that &productdesktop; can. This limitation is mainly caused by the ability to access different type of devices on the two mobile platforms. On Android, a subset of dive computers that use a FTDI USB interface or a Bluetooth/Bluetooth LE interface are accessible by &productmobile;. On iOS, only Bluetooth LE based dive computers are supported.

sect2.title: &productcloud;
sect2.para: &productcloud; is the name given to the &product; web-application and cloud service. It is not possible to download or install &productcloud; because it is a web service that may be utilised by &product; and &productmobile; to backup, store and exchange divelogs between &product; and &productmobile;. It is accessible by a web browser. The web-based application interface of &productcloud; provides a read-only reporting interface.
